title: Upcoming Velkoz Nerfs
body:
I don't normally complain like this anymore, but I really feel the need to here.

Why, when there are far more problematic mages out there - are you nerfing Vel'koz into the ground, Riot?

You are utterly -- disintegrating him.

For clarity: http://i.imgur.com/tgryWdL.png
https://puu.sh/tsI8y/edaa6790ee.png

replies.body: No idea where you're finding those supposed changes, but they're certainly not something we're doing.

Thank god. I would rather be some idiot who got trolled than have my absolutely favorite champion destroyed like that.

Thanks for the quick response.

I don't normally fall for trolls like that - but Vel'koz is very near and dear to my heart. My little brother played this game with me, I got him into it when he was 14. He died when he was 17 - his favorite mage to play was Vel'koz, whenever he wasn't playing with me because I hogged mid. So I got into playing him because of that.

So I was a little emotional. I apologize.
No worries :)
those changes would put him into not only sub 0.1% play rate, but like a 35% win rate

Karthus does have 200 on level 1 ult (I know, I play him. It is a fair cooldown so it wouldn't be too oppressive in laning phase, but it IS 200)

Shen, Taliyah, Twisted Fate, and Rek'sai have 180 sec cds.

Karthus ult *is* 200 CD at rank 1. And it's theoretically not even the longest CD. Yorick's ult has a longer CD provided the Maiden lives for 41 seconds (not entirely unreasonable depending on situation).

I play mid and support Vel'koz, and if the support I am facing is good, they can keep me from bullying out the ADC.

Or if the enemy ADC is good at dodging skillshots, there's not much I can do.

yes there is something you can do

bully the support and the adc with thunderlord, basic attacks that somehow deals a lot of damage and "if they're good at dodging skillshots" it doesn't matter, your mana costs are as low as the work of the balance team and dodging Q is a lot harder than what people think

if you're having troubles with vel'koz support, that means you're playing against an other mage support or karma who's as strong as them
I never have an issue in my lane when I play against a support Vel'koz.

None of those are support Mages.

All 3 are mid laners that can support but that is true with may mage.
And are you trying to say they dont need nerfs because theyre mages? Lmao mage mains

doesn't matter what they are, supports, mages, or carry it doesn't matter

they all need nerfs

Those nerfs would DESTROY Vel'Koz. Statistically Vel'Koz is balanced with almost a 4% play rate and about a 53% winrate. Its debatable about whether or not he's on the strong side but even if he deserves a nerf, this would be way too much.

I'm in a Vel'koz mains clan thing and it was in chat, and it was four or five AM. Things happened.
I was gong to say, welp there goes one of my midlaners joining Shen In the dumpster.

Vel'koz needs nerfs about as much as Xerath does.
Which is not at all.

All Artillery mages are easy to play, save for Syndra **before** her Mage update.

They're both sitting around 52 - 53% win rates, that's quite a bit above average.
That being said, they don't need nerfs.
But he needs nerfs.  to have his Ult do True damage was stupid (as is with all true damage abilities.

No, he doesn't. He's in a perfectly balanced state right now. I played Velkoz before the mage rework, and I played him during the time his ult didn't apply his passive stacks. He did almost nothing.

He relies on that passive. 

"He needs nerfs" If your opinion of one of the most balanced champions in the game is that he needs nerfs, I hate to see what you think of other champions.
This is beyond untrue.
